description: Neo lives a double life as a programmer and hacker. His ordinary world is a simulated reality created by sentient machines to subdue the human population.
Neo is presented with a problem, challenge, or adventure to undertake. This disrupts the comfort of his ordinary world.
Neo refuses the adventure because of hesitation, fears, insecurity, or any other number of issues that prevent him from facing the unknown.
Once Neo has committed to the quest, Morpheus appears to provide supernatural aid, guidance, and a choice between the red pill and the blue pill.
Neo commits to leaving the ordinary world and enters the special world or unknown. He crosses into the field of adventure, leaving the known limits of his world.
Neo is fully separated from his known world and self. This represents a form of self-annihilation and rebirth. He is swallowed into the unknown.
Neo faces tests, tasks, or ordeals that must be overcome. He often fails one or more of these tests, which are repeated until success is achieved.
Neo experiences unconditional love, often represented by a powerful female figure. This represents the point when Neo experiences a love that has the power to inspire.
Neo faces temptations, often of a physical or material nature, that may lead him to abandon or stray from his quest. This tests Neo's ability to focus on the spiritual goal.
Neo must confront whatever holds ultimate power in his life. This is often a father figure or authority that has power over life and death.
Neo achieves a period of rest, peace, and fulfillment before beginning the return. This is the point of realization and greater understanding. Neo dies to his old self.
Neo achieves the goal of the quest. This is the achievement of the goal or the object of the quest. It is what Neo went on the journey to get.
Having found bliss and enlightenment in the other world, Neo may be reluctant to return to the ordinary world to bestow the boon upon his fellow humans.
If the boon has been achieved against the opposition of its guardian, Neo's return may be complicated by pursuit and escape. Neo must retain the wisdom gained during the quest.
Neo may need powerful guides and rescuers to bring him back to everyday life, especially if he has been wounded or weakened by his experience.
Neo crosses the return threshold, bringing his knowledge and experience back to the ordinary world. He is transformed by his journey.
Neo achieves balance between the material and spiritual, the inner and outer worlds. He has become comfortable and competent in both worlds.
Neo is free from fears and anxieties. He lives in the moment, neither anticipating the future nor regretting the past. This is mastery of life.
